org.openadaptor.legacy.convertor.dataobjects
Class DataObjectToOrderedMapConvertor

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.core.Component
      org.openadaptor.auxil.convertor.AbstractConvertor
          org.openadaptor.legacy.convertor.dataobjects.AbstractLegacyConvertor
              org.openadaptor.legacy.convertor.dataobjects.AbstractDataObjectConvertor
                  org.openadaptor.legacy.convertor.dataobjects.DataObjectToOrderedMapConvertor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Administrable, IComponent, IDataProcessor
public class DataObjectToOrderedMapConvertor
extends AbstractDataObjectConvertor

Converts arrays of DataObjects (legacy data format from previous versions of openadaptor) to and array of objects that implement IOrderedMap.

Author:
Russ Fennell, higginse

setConvertDateHolderToDate

public void setConvertDateHolderToDate(boolean convertDateHolderToDate)
Flag to indicate that DateHolder instances should be converted to Date instances.
The default is 'true'.

Parameters:
convertDateHolderToDate - boolean flag

validate

public void validate(java.util.List exceptions)
Description copied from interface: IDataProcessor
This method checks that the current state of an implementation is "meaningful". Implementations of IDataProcessor are typically beans with zero-arg constructors. Implementations are encouraged to add exception to the list parameter rather than throwing them. This allows the calling code to collate the exceptions. If the implementation is an IComponent then the exceptions should be a ValidationException.

Specified by:
validate in interface IDataProcessor
Overrides:
validate in class AbstractConvertor
